entries.meaning: (rare) One who performs dexterous manipulations of objects using the feet.
examples: Mr. Valazzi, the famous juggler and pedipulator now appearing at London halls has joined the school in order to add to his many accomplishments the art of flying.

entries.meaning: (robotics) A component mechanism which gives a robot the capability of walking; a robot having such a capability.
examples: General Electric has been awarded an initial study contract which may lead to the building of a "pedipulator"— a manned walking vehicle intended to replace wheeled or tracked military carriers under certain conditions.
